conference_notes: The term ‘hacking’ has different connotations, sometimes it refers to negative aspects of informatics. In this case, this sharing session addressed the social and civic meaning of ‘hack’, how society can help governments and industry to achieve their goals through open data. This panel gathered four open data experts with different perspectives. The panelists presented their point of view about the participation of the civil society in gathering and re-using public sector information: government’s perspective by Etalab, the French Prime Minister's taskforce for Open Data, enabling a further step in citizen’s participation to develop public policies; the civil society’s perspective by Andrew Kamau, who presented interesting projects to help African citizens; the private perspective by Elena Alfaro, who presented an open data initiative in the banking industry; and the perspective in research by Ali Rebaie, who introduced his anthropologist skills to understand citizens’ needs and possibilities to develop efficient policies.
name: Data + Hacking Data
